means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 伯恩 Bourne的变体

word_mean: 灼伤，烧伤：组织接触干热(火)、湿热(蒸汽或热水)、化学品(如腐蚀物)、电(电流或雷电)、摩擦、辐射或电磁能所致的损伤。Ⅰ度灼伤皮肤发红
Ⅲ度灼伤全层皮肤坏死。Ⅰ度和Ⅱ度灼伤称部分厚度灼伤，Ⅲ度灼伤则称全层厚度灼伤
受火焰烧灼、热水烫、化学物品及放射性物质侵害皮肤所致疾病。

sentence.Network_en: The power stations burn coal from the Ruhr region.
sentence.Network_cn: 发电站烧的煤产自鲁尔地区。

sentence.Network_en: He was a high-earning broker with money to burn.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是高收入的经纪人，有花不完的钱。

sentence.Network_en: Watch them carefully as they finish cooking because they can burn easily.
sentence.Network_cn: 就要做好时得小心看着，因为它们很容易烧糊。

jx.jx_en_mean: To stop burning from lack of fuel.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 烧尽，烧光：因缺乏燃料而停止燃烧

jx.jx_en_mean: To wear out or make or become inoperative as a result of heat or friction
jx.jx_cn_mean: 烧坏：因为热或摩擦而耗尽或变得不能工作

lj.lj_ly: The short circuit burned out the fuse.

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause (a property owner or a resident) to have to evacuate the premises because of fire
jx.jx_cn_mean: 烧掉…的家，烧火把…赶出：因为火灾而使得（财产所有者或居民）不得不疏散财产或从地产中撤离

lj.lj_ly: The shopkeeper was burned out by arsonists.
lj.lj_ls: 店主被纵火犯逐出商店

jx.jx_en_mean: To make or become exhausted, especially as a result of long-term stress
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使疲惫不堪：使变得或变得精疲力尽，尤指因长期地压迫

lj.lj_ly: “Hours are long, stress is high, and many recruits drop out or burn out”(&b{Robert J. Samuelson})
lj.lj_ls: “时间长，压力大，许多新会员已弃权或疲倦不堪”(&b{罗伯特J.塞缪尔森})

lj.lj_ly: Their rudeness really burns me up.
lj.lj_ls: 他们的无礼真的让我生气

jx.jx_en_mean: To travel over or through at high speed
jx.jx_cn_mean: 飞驰，飞奔：以高速跨越或穿过

lj.lj_ly: drag racers burning up the track.
lj.lj_ls: 正在跑道上飞驰的高速赛车

jx.jx_en_mean: (historical)be executed by being tied to a stake and being publicly burned alive, typically for alleged heresy or witchcraft
do something which makes it impossible to return to an earlier state

phrase.cizu_name: burn the candle at both ends

jx.jx_en_mean: go to bed late and get up early
(informal)push one's body to the extremes when doing physical exercise
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（运动时躯体）伸展到极限

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)a state of slowly mounting anger or annoyance

lj.lj_ly: the medical community's shrugging acceptance is fuelling a slow burn among women.
lj.lj_ls: 医疗界接纳女性时的勉强态度逐渐引起了她们的愤怒。

phrase.cizu_name: with money burning in a hole of one's pocket

jx.jx_en_mean: having a strong urge to spend money as soon as one receives it
(of a building or structure) destroy or be destroyed completely by fire
jx.jx_cn_mean: （建筑物）（被）焚为平地，烧得精光

lj.lj_ly: designs are burnt into the skin.
a childhood incident that was burnt into her memory.
lj.lj_ls: 深深印在她记忆中的一件童年往事。

lj.lj_ly: using a blowlamp to burn off the paint.

jx.jx_en_mean: ruin one's health or become completely exhausted through overwork
jx.jx_cn_mean: 积劳成疾；（超时工作而）把身体搞坏

jx.jx_en_mean: make someone homeless by destroying their home by fire
jx.jx_cn_mean: （用火烧毁某人的房屋）使某人无家可归

lj.lj_ly: Catholics and Protestants were &B{burned out} of their homes.
lj.lj_ls: 天主教徒和新教徒家被烧了，已都无家可归。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  birnan 'be on fire' and baernan 'consume by fire', both from the same Germanic base; related to German brennen
Old English  burna, burn(e), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bron and German Brunnen 'well'

entry.def: If there is a fire or a flame somewhere, you say that there is a fire or flame burning there.

example.ex: Fires were burning out of control in the center of the city...
example.tran: 市中心的火势失去了控制。

example.ex: There was a fire burning in the large fireplace...
example.tran: 大壁炉里火势正旺。

entry.def: If something is burning, it is on fire.

example.ex: When I arrived one of the vehicles was still burning.
example.tran: 当我到达时，其中一辆车还在燃烧。

example.ex: The building housed 1,500 refugees and it burned for hours...
example.tran: 这幢住有1,500名难民的大楼燃烧了好几个小时。

entry.def: If you burn something, you destroy or damage it with fire.

example.ex: Protesters set cars on fire and burned a building...
example.tran: 抗议者焚烧汽车，并烧毁了一座建筑。

example.ex: Incineration plants should be built to burn household waste...
example.tran: 应该建立焚烧厂以焚毁日常生活垃圾。

entry.def: If you burn a fuel or if it burns, it is used to produce heat, light, or energy.

example.ex: The power stations burn coal from the Ruhr region...
example.tran: 发电站烧的煤产自鲁尔地区。

example.ex: Manufacturers are working with new fuels to find one that burns more cleanly than petrol.
example.tran: 制造商们正在研制新型燃料，以找到一种比汽油更清洁的燃料。

entry.def: If you burn something that you are cooking or if it burns, you spoil it by using too much heat or cooking it for too long.

example.ex: I burnt the toast...
example.tran: 我把面包烤糊了。

example.ex: Watch them carefully as they finish cooking because they can burn easily.
example.tran: 就要做好时得小心看着，因为它们很容易烧糊。

entry.def: If you burn part of your body, burn yourself, or are burnt, you are injured by fire or by something very hot.

example.ex: Take care not to burn your fingers...
example.tran: 注意别烧着手指头。

example.ex: If you are badly burnt, seek medical attention.
example.tran: 如果是严重烧伤，就得去看医生。

entry.def: If someone is burnt or burnt to death, they are killed by fire.

example.ex: Women were burned as witches in the middle ages...
example.tran: 妇女在中世纪时被当成女巫烧死。

example.ex: At least 80 people were burnt to death when their bus caught fire.
example.tran: 大客车着火导致至少80人被烧死。

entry.def: If a light is burning, it is shining.

example.ex: The building was darkened except for a single light burning in a third-story window.
example.tran: 整座大楼一片漆黑，只有3层的一个窗户透出一丝光亮。

entry.def: If your face is burning, it is red because you are embarrassed or upset.

example.ex: Liz's face was burning.
example.tran: 利兹的脸红得发烫。

entry.tran: 有强烈的情感；极度渴望
entry.def: If you are burning with an emotion or are burning to do something, you feel that emotion or the desire to do that thing very strongly.

example.ex: The young boy was burning with a fierce ambition...
example.tran: 这个年轻人怀有极其远大的抱负。

example.ex: Dan burned to know what the reason could be.
example.tran: 丹急于想知道原因。

entry.def: If you burn or get burned in the sun, the sun makes your skin become red and sore.

example.ex: Build up your tan slowly and don't allow your skin to burn...
example.tran: 慢慢地将皮肤晒成古铜色，小心别让太阳把皮肤晒伤。

example.ex: Summer sun can burn fair skin in minutes.
example.tran: 夏天的太阳几分钟就能把白皙的皮肤晒黑。

entry.def: If a part of your body burns or if something burns it, it has a painful, hot or stinging feeling.

example.ex: My eyes burn from staring at the needle...
example.tran: 我的眼睛由于长时间盯着针看而疼痛。

example.ex: His face was burning with cold.
example.tran: 他的脸被冻得发痛。

entry.def: If you are burned or get burned, you lose something as a result of taking a risk, usually in a business deal.

example.ex: They always took chances and got burned very badly in past years.
example.tran: 他们总是冒险，在过去的几年里损失惨重。

entry.def: To burn a CD-ROM means to write or copy data onto it.

example.ex: You can use this software to burn custom compilations of your favorite tunes.
example.tran: 你可以用这个软件来刻录你最喜欢的乐曲。

means.word_mean: 1. pain that feels hot as if it were on fire
2. a browning of the skin resulting from exposure to the rays of the sun
3. an injury cause by exposure to heat or chemicals or radiation

sentences.sentence: "They burned the house and his diaries"

means.word_mean: 2. shine intensely, as if with heat;

sentences.sentence: "The coals were glowing in the dark"

means.word_mean: 4. cause a sharp or stinging pain or discomfort;

sentences.sentence: "We combust coal and other fossil fuels"

means.word_mean: 6. feel strong emotion, especially anger or passion;

sentences.sentence: "He was burning to try out his new skies"

means.word_mean: 11. burn, sear, or freeze (tissue) using a hot iron or electric current or a caustic agent;
12. get a sunburn by overexposure to the sun
15. burn with heat, fire, or radiation;

sentences.sentence: "The iron burnt a hole in my dress"

example.en: It is eight months since his wife burned her foot.
example.zh: 他妻子已怀孕八个月了。

auth_sentence.res_content: They effectively seem to 'burn themselves out' sooner.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They effectively seem to 'burn themselves out' sooner.

auth_sentence.content: People turn their heads, eyes burn into us.
auth_sentence.res_content: People turn their heads, eyes burn into us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People turn their heads, eyes burn into us.

auth_sentence.res_content: Hard prune shoots in spring and burn the prunings.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 燃烧的, 强烈的, 极严重的

Sentence.sentence: One of the greatest heartbreaks for fire fighters occurs when they fail to rescue a child from a burning building because the child, frightened by smoke and noise, hides under a bed or in a closet and is later found dead.
Why do some children trapped in a burning building hide from masked fire fighters
Yet until recently the worst forecasts were almost exclusively linked to direct human activity, such as clear-cutting and burning for pastures or farms.

Each burning season in the Amazon, fires deliberately set by frontier settlers and developers hurl up almost half a billion metric tons of carbon a year, placing Brazil among the top five contributors to greenhouse gases in the world
Its practice of burning forests for settlement and development.

sentences.en: The fire burnt the grass quickly.
People used to burn an oil lamp to get light.

means.word_mean: 烧毁, 烧坏, 烧伤，烫伤

sentences.cn: 这栋房子多年前被烧毁。

sentences.en: Some acids are strong enough to burn the wood.
sentences.cn: 有些酸的酸性强得可以烧坏木头。

sentences.en: She was burnt in a raging fire while working in a factory.
sentences.cn: 她在工厂工作时被烈火烧伤了。

sentences.en: He died of the burns he received in the fire.
sentences.cn: 他因在火灾中受烧伤而死。
